page.title: 05THE HISTORY OF STOCKTON
page.content: STOCKTON WAS RECORDED IN DOMESDAY BOOK WHEN THE MANOR WAS HELD BY THE NORMAN GERARD DE TOURNAI. ITS NAME IN O.E. IS STOCC-TUN "HOMESTEAD BUILT OF LOGS". LITTLE OF ITS EARLY HISTORY REMAINS A FEW FIELD CROP MARKS, THATCHED COTTAGES,PLUS THE STOCKS AND WHIPPING POST.THE EARLIEST RECORD IS 13O8.IN THE 17TH CENTURY THE WHITMORE FAMILY BECAME A MAJOR INFLUENCE IN THE AREA AND WERE MEMBERS OF PARLIAMENT FOR 25O YEARS.DURING THE CIVIL WAR SIR WILLIAM WHITMORE OWNED THE MANOR,HE WAS A ROYALIST AND WAS CAPTURED IN THE HALL AFTER A PARLIAMENTARY SIEGE.AFTER AN ARMED ATTEMPT TP RETAKE THE MANOR HE PAID Â£5OOO TO REDEEM IT. THOMAS WHITMORE REBUILT APLEY HALL IN 1811.
